Talon:

Talon went where Lord Perseus was. she was determined to Follow her=
 leader now among the Maximal was her new life since she had given up her f=
ormer one.




From: Sandy 
Sent: Wednesday, July 29, 2009 10:00 AM
To: nbw=
rpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: Re: Farewell Atlantis


  Even though the mes=
sage had gone out to the Maximals, Tucson could not bare to ignore the radi=
o transmission. He suspaces his cross bow over his shoulder, as the mechani=
sms over his back latch it in place. 

"Sounds like this could be important=
. I better try to get to the tower, and see what the transmission is about.=
 Sorry cross bow, you'll have to wait a while".

With his sight impaired, h=
e turns to his sonar system atop his helmet, and throws off a sonar wave, w=
hich he hoped would bounce off the tower, and back to him, giving Tucson th=
e exact coordinates in which to follow. He also knew that being on wheels w=
ould be faster than trying to go there on foot. Metal plates soon shift and=
 within moments he is transformed into his vehicular mode. The compact SUV =
shifts himself into all wheel drive, and slowly rolls toward the direction =
of the tower, which he obtains with sonar system capability.

--- In nbwrpg=
@yahoogroups.com, Kraftlos <kraftlos@...> wrote:
>
> "Attention Maximals" t=
he radios suddenly blared. "This is Lord
> Perseus, please assemble in fron=
t of the tower."
> 
> Ravenchief and a team of maximals pulled a large hove=
rcart toward the tower.
> 
> "Is that everything?" Salveo asked Ravenchief =
as they aproached the tower.
> 
> "Yessir, fortunately a couple CR chambers=
 and about half our supplies
> survived the impact. This is the last of it.=
"
> 
> "What all this about?" asked Guardia as she walked toward the tower.=

> 
> "The boss has an announcement," Salveo replied. "He'll be right down,=

> so everyone wait here."
> 
> Tag: All Maximals in Atlantis.
> 
> On 7/12=
/09, Kraftlos <kraftlos@...> wrote:
> > "I appreciate the research help you=
 have given us over the years,"
> > said Lord Perseus.
> >
> > At the top o=
f the Atlantis tower, the mayor's office had a bird's eye
> > view of the d=
estroyed city. It had taken three weeks to clear the
> > rubble and begin r=
ebuilding; the Maximal base however, was a total
> > loss: only the lower l=
evel remained, which merely contained a
> > destroyed ractor system and the=
 prison cells, which concievably be
> > modified to be used by the loca pol=
ice.
> >
> > "So you'll be leaving us?" asked the mayor, already knowing th=
e answer.
> >
> > "Yes. I've come to the conclusion that our presence in th=
e city
> > merely aggrivates conditions. Without us, this island would beco=
me a
> > much lower priority for our enemies. Though I hope we can continue=

> > our research together; and I promise we will do anything we can to
> >=
 help the city."
> >
> > "So where will you be going?" the mayor asked afte=
r a moment of silence.
> >
> > Perseus walked to the windows and sighed.
> =
>
> > "We Maximals have been divided for too long. With this Unicronian
> >=
 threat, and our recent truce with Megatron. it would be apropriate for
> >=
 us to put our diferences aside and work together. So we'll first be
> > go=
ing to meet with Lord Elder."
> >
> > "Well my friend, I wish you the best =
of success. You are always welcome
> > here."
> >
> > "Thank you."
> >
>


=
